intro: Killickia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy killickia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Killickia pilosa is often found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woods.
